com.kuka.roboticsAPI.controllerModel.sunrise

Interface ISunriseSensorModuleConnection


  • public interface ISunriseSensorModuleConnection
    Interface to configure and monitor a sunrise sensor module.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      OutPort getCurrentSensorValuePort()
      Return the OutPort of the module, which provides the current sensor value.
      OutPort getExpectedSensorValuePort()
      Return the OutPort of the module, which provides the expected sensor value (T)
      String getIdentifier()
      Return the identifier.
      boolean isActive()
      Get the isActive flag.
      Object verifyConnection()
      Verify the sensor connection.

    • Method Detail

      • isActive

        boolean isActive()
        Get the isActive flag.

        A sensor connection should return true, when its data is valid. The definition of valid varies depending of the sensor.

        This might be moved into IQueryConnection or IFrameConnection

        Returns:
        the isActive flag

      • verifyConnection

        Object verifyConnection()
        Verify the sensor connection.

        As sensors consist of different levels of complexity (simple light barrier to a embedded system smart-cam) the verification of data/connection also could be complex. In case of a simple binary sensor, this method could equal isActive(). In more complex case, for example, a finite state machine that implements a tri-state could be implemented (Off, OnInvalid, OnValid).

        This might be moved into IQueryConnection or IFrameConnection

        Returns:
        the verification object

      • getIdentifier

        String getIdentifier()
        Return the identifier.

        Every sensor connection has a unique identifier. If the sensor value is calculated outside the Robotics API (e.g on an external device) this identifier can be used to map the data.

        This might be moved into IQueryConnection or IFrameConnection

        Returns:
        the identifier

      • getCurrentSensorValuePort

        OutPort getCurrentSensorValuePort()
        Return the OutPort of the module, which provides the current sensor value. (T1m)
        Returns:
        the published port of the module.

      • getExpectedSensorValuePort

        OutPort getExpectedSensorValuePort()
        Return the OutPort of the module, which provides the expected sensor value (T)
        Returns:
        the published port of the module.
